metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19655 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A stack-based buffer overflow in the find_green() function of dcraw through 9.28, as used in ufraw-batch and many other products, may allow a remote attacker to cause a control-flow hijack, denial-of-service, or unspecified other impact via a maliciously crafted raw photo file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gimp-ufraw - 0.22-3.1~build0.18.04.1
ufraw - 0.22-3.1~build0.18.04.1
ufraw-batch - 0.22-3.1~build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dcraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
ufraw package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.22-3.1~build0.18.04.1').
